body: @zznate When you get a chance can you please review this?
The change has been merged. Closing the PR.
Looks like this PR has been merged and can be closed now.

@sumanth-pasupuleti it would be awesome if you apply comments of @vinaykumarchella on top of https://github.com/sumanth-pasupuleti/cassandra/pull/3/files

thank you

Squashed & rebased:
CI [j11](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/336/workflows/60657405-8afb-4500-800f-75a04cba10b2)
CI [j8](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/336/workflows/1309175d-c63c-418a-90f6-f10cbf03629c)

Unrelated failures
I have covered few cornercases here https://github.com/instaclustr/cassandra/commit/1b19a8257340118aa9423d8e8bb40ed0e327ecb5
Review comments addressed and I raised the timeout to 250 just to be on the safe side :shrug:

fyi, incorporated @smiklosovic changes into the PR. 
@smiklosovic @vinaykumarchella @alex-ninja curious if you have any additional feedback

Thank you @sumanth-pasupuleti and @smiklosovic for the quick changes. 
I am still testing the patch. Also, I believe @smiklosovic is still looking into the BATCH issue mentioned here https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-16669?focusedCommentId=17360888&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17360888
and we need to add more tests for the corner cases.  Can we also add tests for empty passwords and passwords with whitespaces? Thank you
@ekaterinadimitrova2 yes they are there, in my branch, tests covering empty passwords and spaces too

LGTM, just the comment about `test-memory`.
Thanks for spotting the guava dependency under java-allocation-instrumenter.

for future reference, `Merge remote-tracking branch …` (or merges from mainlines to dev branches) aren't useful for PRs/reviewers. Patches should be rebased off their mainlines, not merged (bi-directional merging makes a mess of things).

(i'm fixing this as i commit…)

I am closing this, because of a similar pull-request https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/491 that has been accepted.
Closed in favor of Caleb's proposal.

LGTM, thanks a lot for fixing this issue.
Would love to see it backported to 3.x if possible.
Committed into cassandra-3.0 at eadb171d5dfa9de3ecc6dce47515d48771fa98f9 and merged into cassandra-3.11, cassandra-4.0 and trunk
Great! Thanks a lot for taking your time to work on this issue.
Just rebased on latest trunk, which includes the last few fixes that made it into 4.0.0

@josh-mckenzie 

adding the missing steps required in the `Release version in JIRA` section
sorry for the delay, I will address all the feedback and pull in the latest SAI interface, then ping you for review
Yeah I can update the PR and clean up a bit more. I cannot possibly cover everything though.

Whops. Used wrong issue id in commit, fixed in title.
working on patch to make it so we can disable this behavior (leaving as default in 4.1 release for now)
As per @ekaterinadimitrova2 's suggestion, try targeting the latest stable Jackson release, 2.12(.4).

Failures seem to be timeouts and similarly flaky natured but I tested they pass locally

This looks to be a very useful addition for operators. 👍 

For posterity, I'm posting my suggestions here from ASF Slack:

- log a ticket here https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=12310865 with details of your proposal
- then post the ticket + details to the `dev@` mailing list so you'll get better traction
- you might also want to post in #cassandra-dev and request someone to mentor/coach you on your first contribution so it's a smoother process

Cheers! 🍻
The `deriveIfOpenSslAvailable` change looks good. It will be interesting to see what you need to change to support your use case.

CI:
- Baseline 3.11 nightly run [here](https://ci-cassandra.apache.org/job/Cassandra-3.11/225/#showFailuresLink)
- [Jenkins ci](https://ci-cassandra.apache.org/job/Cassandra-devbranch/1038/#showFailuresLink) looks aligned baseline but there are some mismatches. I can't tell if they're meaningful.
- [CircleCI](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/395/workflows/78d94741-52be-4e17-aa1f-68f4b7254c5b):
 - Dtest upgrade test failures are bc circle shouldn't be running 4.0 tests. They get skipped in jenkins.
 - Jvm upgrade tests failures also fail in baseline
 - Dtests also fail in baseline. `test_long_order` it's a connection error and passes locally.
@jonmeredith tried to add internode, this should cover at least the examples you showed me.
